title: No Man's Land
description: When a cocksure lawyer heads into the badlands of China's Xinjiang province, hoping a pro bono case will win him fame and acclaim, he sets into motion a series of unfortunate events that expose the harsh realities of life in the next world superpower. Writer-director Ning Hao made a splash at Fantastic Fest V with his labyrinthine crime caper CRAZY RACER, but this unflinching, darkly comic follow-up exposes his homeland as an amoral wasteland populated by hookers, crooks and con artists looking to make a quick buck. It's little wonder the Chinese censors balked at Ning's too-honest portrayal and it went unreleased for four long years.
synopsis: A city lawyer fights for his life in the cutthroat deserts of contemporary China in Ning Hao's Coen-esque follow-up to CRAZY RACER, which was banned for four years.
